alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Franklin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 4:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN AND SOUTHWESTERN FAYETTE COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 414 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Lake Santee, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Santee, Laurel, Hamburg, Buena Vista and Andersonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
